title: Use Log Rules
speech: Logarithm multiplication rule:  the log base a of b, plus the log base a of c is equal to, the log base a of b c . log{10}{x}+log{10}{x-15}=og{10}{x*(x-15)}
pacedSpeech: Logarithm multiplication rule:   the log base a of b, plus the log base a of c is equal to, the log base a of b c

title: Turn the Constant into log
text: Use the definition of logarithm, we get $$2=\log_{10}\left(100\right)$$ since $${10}^2=100$$.
speech: Use the definition of logarithm, we get  2 is equal to, the log base 10 of 100,  since  10 squared is equal to 100 .
pacedSpeech: Use the definition of logarithm, we get   2 is equal to, the log base 10 of 100,

title: Match Bases
text: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes $$x \left(x-15\right)=100$$. $$x^2-15x-100=0$$. We can factor the quadratic as $$\left(x-20\right) \left(x+5\right)=0$$ which has $$x=20$$ and $$x=-5$$ as solutions.
speech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes  x, parentheses x minus 15,  is equal to 100 .  x squared, minus 15 x minus 100 is equal to 0 . We can factor the quadratic as  parentheses x minus 20,  times, parentheses x plus 5,  is equal to 0  which has  x, is equal to 20  and  x, is equal to negative 5  as solutions.

.   x squared, minus 15 x minus 100 is equal to 0

title: Check for Constrains
text: Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get $$x=20$$ as the only solution for the equation.
speech: Given  the log base a of b, ,  b  can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get  x is equal to 20  as the only solution for the equation.

can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get   x is equal to 20
